reviewText: Let's do the easy stuff first. This is an SAVE version of Phantom. It comes in a single package with four disks. They played well but have no fripperies. The picture and sound quality were fine and the dubbing synched well enough.This should, I think, be compared to NOIR. It's about organized crime, it's about an assassin with an unknown past, there's tension between the main protagonists and there's an external force manipulating things to some unknown goal. I can hardly tell them apart. However NOIR had a soundtrack which supported the action Phantom's is there. I found I cared about the characters in NOIR but in Phantom I didn't so what went wrong?Warning - Plot spoilersThis is described as being about the rescue of Ein who is a young girl who has been brainwashed into becoming a mob assassin. In reality it is more about the descent of Reijy who is also brainwashed into becoming an assassin. Reijy is able to recover his past and choose his future path. There are all sorts of side plots where various factions argue amongst themselves with mostly expected outcomes. There's even a recall show. As a show it was reasonably predictable. The principal cast of characters are mostly unsympathetic and this is especially the case with Reijy. He choses his life of crime and killing and you have no idea why he so easily rejects his former life but then is so keen to help EIn recover hers. The villain of the piece is crudely drawn and overdone and the ending is in many ways bizarre and a predictable let down. I found myself thinking "I knew that was going to happen 10 episodes ago" which is not a good way to go through a 26  (or was it 24 episode anime). Mind you, the last two episodes do move along quite nicely and ovrall the action scenes are well done.Phantom tries to keep to a realistic style. It's well drawn and looks great, the visual style works although you'd think that characters would change clothes in two years. Some liberties are taken with the movement of the killers but that is done to highlight their superiority in that role and as such it works. There are some famous bloopers though. Who ahs ever seen a Ferrari F40 with electric windows - nope. When was an Alfa 156 allowed to drive in the US - Nope. And did they confuse Los Angeles with San Francisco at one point? I think they did. Just how did Cal age so quickly?So all in all I thought this was a disappointment. Too slow with characters I couldn't really care about. The actions good but the plot's unnecessarily convoluted and it lacks pace. So I'd give this a miss especially if you've seen NOIR. There's really no comparison.

reviewText: Phantom: Requiem for the Phantom was not in my must-haves but after reading various helpful reviews by other Amazon buyers I decided to give it a go. I was pleasantly surprised. The quality is very good, the story is engaging and the characters are convincingly damaged.The story's background is a sinister organised crime syndicate named Inferno. Its members are not bound by any particular honor or loyalty, and to some extent, treachery is rewarded. A brilliant but warped behavioral scientist is part of the inner circle. We do not learn the back-story on this, and this is one of the small elements that take the overall rating down a notch. His contribution is to train a young girl to be an assassin, code-named The Phantom. He names her Ein (German for One, not a friendly nickname!) to further dehumanize her. During one of her missions she encounters a young Japanese tourist, who shows such unusual resource in escaping her immediate attacks that the sinister doctor decides to recruit him. Memory wiped, the young man is codenamed "Zwei" (Two) and trained by Ein to be just as good, if not better.Enter the machinations of the inner circle of Inferno. Betrayal piles upon betrayal. Zwei and Ein find themselves set against one another. The Phantom Ein dies and is replaced by The Phantom Zwei. But Zwei has by that time reclaimed his humanity. He takes a very young girl under his wing, and begins training her as Drei, fearing he would otherwise be told to execute her. Then further twists reveal that Ein did not die after all. Zwei, believing Drei dead, flees with Ein to begin a new life back in Japan. And that's just the first half!The second half should be viewed as a second season. It features different music, and subtly different art. More significantly the story setting is now "Japanese high-school students with secret abilities" very far removed from the gritty, grimy Urban America setting of the first half. Will Ein and Zwei be able to defend themselves as Inferno closes in? And will Zwei be able to kindle any spark of humanity in the insane killer, The Phantom codenamed Drei?Some viewers grumble about the ending but if you have seen and enjoyed a few Chinese dramas it's no biggie. It's not a happy ending and that's all there is to it.Music is very good. I preferred the first half but it's consistently good.Artwork is excellent. Minor styling inconsistencies as a natural result of a change in Art Director for the second half.Story is very good, though with 26 episodes more could have been done on back-stories of more of the key players. Half a star off that that. Half a star deducted for the lazy plotting which inserted two adults into a Japanese High School genre.

reviewText: I've been sifting through the S.A.V.E. piles looking for rare gems and anime titles that shouldn't be there.  "Phantom" should.  The animation is adequate.  Some of the action is fluid while the rest is flat and subpar.  The characters are interesting for the first 5 episodes, but then the leads fall into a Romeo and Juliet forbidden love quest that really doesn't grow beyond that.The female lead "Ein" waxes on about her life not being hers and that nothingness is absolute.  While that concept could work for the show with a more clever brainwashing process, or utilization of strategic character isolation, it instead feels unrealistic and forced.  The show is laced with repetitive themes that don't grow and are warranted by the thinnest of motivations.The mob aspect of the show is extremely unimaginative.  The power plays are mostly unexplained and boring, and their methods of execution never go beyond sniper rifles and drive by’s.  Their methods of brainwashing and control are unrealistic and bland.  The love story is intriguing at first, but goes nowhere fast (and you know where it's going from the second episode).All in all, this is an adequate mobster/love story anime, but not even close to great.  The show didn't use any brain power to create and doesn't ask for any to watch.  The animation doesn't inspire greatness, but is clean enough to not disappoint.  You're not getting much here so it better be cheap, AND IT IS!If you know what you're getting into and you're expectations are low, then you might enjoy this and find yourself rooting for this mind wiped couple's mindless journey to find love, freedom and a sense of worth.
summary: A mind wiped duo of depressed teens embarks on a mindless journey . . . but they kill people so . . .

reviewText: A young man with no memories fights to salvage his humanity when he’s forced into a life of murder by a dangerous crime syndicate called Inferno. The organization gives him a new name, Zwei, and molds him into a perfect killing machine, a meticulous instrument of death created to obey his masters’ every deadly command. Zwei has no memory but he dose have a bloody future.The story is Violent, Dark and deep.  To me you had to watch every episode to keep up with the few story arcs it has.  The Animation is really  good, deep and adds the dark tone to the story.Watch a few episodes online first because this anime may not be for everyone.Due to a lot of violence, blood, some gore and language Don't let the kids watch it.
summary: A man with no memory but has a bloody future

reviewText: I really liked this series a lot. It  is the story of 2 assassins. Ein and Zwei have had their memories wiped and are made to do assassinations for the Inferno syndicate. They start to grow closer to one another and question whether they should continue their work. There are lots of good action scenes and plenty of drama. This anime was kind of a mix of Noir and Darker than Black. Very cool and engrossing.Everything about this anime is top notch. The animation is incredible. The voice actors are great, and the soundtrack is very cool. You could go on forever about the coolness of Phantom. Instead of rambling, I'll just recommend that you check it out. I really enjoyed it and I hope you do to.

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: It took me a couple of episodes to get into this series, and it's not one I'll soon forget. It has some of the most memorable - and tragic - figures in Anime. No giant robots or wizards, demons or aliens. This is the story of professional assassins, brainwashed and brutally trained into their profession. We stare with Einz and Zwei, then later add Drei. All three are high-school aged kids, and all are the best at their profession.  This is realistic, sometimes heart-wrenching, usually action-packed animation. It's similar to Ghost in the Shell in it's look and feel, only set in modern times with modern weapons.  Mob bosses using specially trained assassins to keep other mob families in line.  We have unrequited love, brutal assassinations (some are pretty shocking), world-class animation and voice actors, and is one of the best I have seen in ages.The ending - the real ending - is in the final credits, and it's a shocker. Is it open ended?  Not really, but I suppose a third season could be produced with appropriate explanations, although these would border on the unbelievable. You'll find yourself cheering for these three assassins, and when they inevitably have to face off against each other, you're not sure who to cheer for.  On the other hand, all are cold-blooded killers, so why cheer for any of them? Because you grow to like these psychopaths.Many of the other main characters in this series are emotionally broken, cold and calculating, manipulative - you name it. When a character meets his or her end, it's often a total shock, but done masterfully.Do yourself a favor and get this series. It's amazingly well done, from the knife fights to gun battles, hand-to-hand to - well, you name it.
summary: This is one that will stick with you! An amazing series.

reviewText: Woah! This anime will tear you UP! No joke!No fan service here, that I recall. Just violence. Few curse words.Animation is motion picture quality. Totally awesome. Action sequences are full-on, but not Dragonball Z crazy.Character development is righteous here. Throughout this series, an insight is given into all the characters in the fore of the story. You gain an understanding of their motivations and their characterizations stay true. The story sweeps along, carrying the unwilling participants in a struggle to maintain not only their lives, but justify their moral direction and life purpose. The main characters are infused with life and personality, which served to draw me into the world of these merciless criminal organizations. Interactions were true and heartfelt. I was a powerless onlooker as characters I wished I could help were caught in personal trials or nasty fire fights. Don't you shoot at Ein you son of a...I will side kick you so hard!!! Raahhh!!The phantoms...butt whoopin, two mile headshotin, double tappin, no muss death dealers... caught by the carrion fingers of power hungry criminals. Used and abused. Brainwashed to take life without question. But a fragile human heart still beats in these assassins, which is the life of this story.But prepare yourself for the ending. It gonna tear out your heart, stomp on it a couple times, and spit at you! Right at your eye! Cause its MEAN!! Just when everyone (you and the characters) let your guard down. Ack!! I hated it for like a week! I was like, what a bunch of at sign dollar sign dollar signs! Tossed it in the closet. Then I loved it. I took it out of the closet. Put it with my other anime.So anyhoo, anime fans...if you haven't already, check this out!! And make your non-anime friends watch it with you! Buy em pizza if you have to!! Tell them they cant handle it cause it rocks! yup.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Anytime you put assassins, treachery, angst and possible romance in a storyline and DO THEM ALL EQUALLY WELL, you've got yourself a winner my friend!  I bought this series as soon as it dropped and I absolutely loved it. I already bought the Phantom OVA that was released years ago with just a few episodes and this is basically a better re-telling of that story.I NEVER compare anime to manga from 2 different series- (#1 it's not the same art form #2 you shouldn't compare moving art to still art). Another reviewer compared Phantom to a title that was released 15-20 years ago, criticizing this series. Comparing one title's anime to another title's MANGA is just plain bad reviewing.This anime falls in the same category (I guess) as Noir, Madlax etc., but those can't hold a candle to this series. It has way better production quality.  It was masterfully animated, excellent English dub, kick-ass action and plenty of likeable characters. The musical score made my heart wrench. Do they have an OST CD?? I wonder.The ending, as anime sometimes does, isn't FULLY a true ending which leaves it open for a possible continuation. I hope like hell this is the case- I've already watched the whole thing twice.While everyone's entitled to their own opinion, I have difficulty seeing anyone rate this lower than 4 stars.  It's not perfect, but it's damn close. It gets a 9.5/10 from me.

reviewText: I almost wish I'd never bought this anime. It's that good. You know what I'm talking about. A work of art so good you fear you might never experience that freshness of wonder again. All too often what passes for a story in anime, movies, tv shows, or books etc. is only a vehicle to showcase special effects, an actor or actress, a technology, or to pander to the baser instincts of our lives. This anime is not for children or maybe not even teenagers or young adults not because of sex or violence but because to really understand it you have to have reached a level of maturity or jadedness in life that has left you feeling as empty as the characters themselves do. That being said I believe that if you have a heart at all, even just a smidgen like me, you can't help but to be touched deeply by this. Makes you wonder if you've been really living all this time. Like I said, I almost wish I'd never bought this anime.
summary: Too bad I can't give it six stars!
